review: Hardware wise, I thought the Five Tv was very good. The device worked with ease, was very fast and responsive, great graphics, and never froze up. The only flaw was the lack of a Power (On/Off) button, but rather just a "Sleep" option that had to be done manually through the settings menu. On the Software side of things is where I feel the Fire Tv falls short. There is a limited number of Apps  and many Apps other streaming players offer, the Fire Tv does not. I also would've liked web browser capability.
author: Jules

review: I received this product yesterday. Since I have an older TV I needed to also purchase a HDMI to composite video converter ($20). [The Amazon Fire TV only has a HDMI output]. Nevertheless, everything connected together without any problems. I then powered up the system and it recognized me immediately. It also 'knew' that it was connected with an internet cable to the router.After playing around with 'clicker' I became familiar with the operation. It is very intuitive! The picture quality was very good. There are VERY many channels,some are free many are not. But it is a whole new world out there.The product worked exactly as advertised.
